Explainability.justification: Score = 1 because 1 source(s) (listed below) contain detailed, verifiable information.

relevantSources.title: Senior Data Scientist at Genuine Parts Company
relevantSources.summary: Job posting mentions explainable AI methods for model adoption and implementation.
relevantSources.evaluation: The job posting explicitly requires experience with explainable AI (xAI) techniques such as SHAP and LIME, indicating concrete adoption of explainability practices.

Explainability.findings: The Senior Data Scientist job description at Genuine Parts Company lists explainable AI (xAI) as a core responsibility, requiring candidates to implement interpretability frameworks like SHAP and LIME. This provides concrete evidence that explainability is a documented requirement in their AI development processes.

Privacy & Security.justification: Score = 1 because 2 source(s) (listed below) contain detailed, verifiable information.

relevantSources.title: SUSTAINABILITY REPORT
relevantSources.summary: Sustainability report mentions data transparency and security measures.
relevantSources.evaluation: The sustainability report details encryption standards, access controls, and GDPR compliance, providing concrete evidence of privacy and security practices.

relevantSources.title: Genuine Parts Company - Zaviant
relevantSources.summary: Case study describes robust data security and privacy program implementation.
relevantSources.evaluation: The case study describes enterprise-wide data classification, automated PII detection, and real-time monitoring, demonstrating concrete privacy and security controls.

Privacy & Security.findings: Genuine Parts Company's sustainability report and a third-party case study both document robust privacy and security practices, including encryption, access controls, GDPR compliance, data classification, and real-time monitoring for sensitive data. These sources confirm that privacy and security are actively managed and publicly described.

Governance & Accountability.justification: Score = 1 because 1 source(s) (listed below) contain detailed, verifiable information.

relevantSources.title: Genuine Parts Company Modernizes Cyber Risk Management with ThreatConnect
relevantSources.summary: Case study showing governance approach to cyber risk management and security investments.
relevantSources.evaluation: The case study provides concrete evidence of governance, including board-level oversight, quarterly risk assessments, and integration of NIST CSF into vendor management.

Governance & Accountability.findings: A case study on cyber risk management reveals that Genuine Parts Company has established board-level cybersecurity oversight, formal risk assessment protocols, and integrated industry-standard frameworks into governance. This demonstrates a structured approach to governance and accountability for technology risks.

summary.overallFindings: Genuine Parts Company demonstrates responsible AI strengths in explainability, privacy and security, and governance, with concrete evidence of practices such as explainable AI requirements, robust data protection, and formal cyber risk oversight. However, there is no public documentation addressing transparency, fairness, human oversight, or external audit commitments. The company's responsible AI maturity appears focused on operational and compliance domains, with significant gaps in public-facing policy and ethical transparency.
